pageContext.claim: “We'll be in a position just like Venezuela. Twenty years ago it was one of the wealthiest nations in the world and per capita one of the wealthiest. And now, it's -- they don't have water, they don't have medicine, they don't even have food.”
pageContext.analysis: In the late 1960s, Venezuela’s gross domestic product per capita was comparable with high income countries, and in the 1970s, it was among the richest countries in Latin America. But the World Bank always considered it a middle-income country, not in the ranks of the richest or poorest nations on earth.
